definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: His mind reached after an understanding of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他开动脑筋，想弄懂这个问题。
不动脑子，我就活不下去。

sentences.english: Using your head, you'll find a good way.
sentences.chinese: 动动脑，你就会想出一个好办法。

sentences.english: You must use your own head.
Encourage students to think more, and be more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 鼓励学生在学习中多动脑，更自觉主动的学习。

sentences.english: Because I follow a classic pattern, the coding is almost brainless.
sentences.chinese: 因为我沿用了经典模式，因此编码几乎不用动脑子。

sentences.english: So I need to do something intelligent to exercise my brain.
sentences.chinese: 所以我得做点开动脑筋的事情让大脑也得到锻炼。
开动脑筋，为剧本想些点子。

sentences.english: Solve your urgent problems with a little creativity.
sentences.chinese: 所以在解决紧急问题时动动脑筋。

sentences.english: The second was not to rush unthinkingly to grab a small profit.
sentences.chinese: 第二个教训是不要不动脑筋地急于抓住蝇头小利。
这些生意是最不需要动脑子的。

sentences.english: Other research shows that people with spring birthdays like to exercise their minds.
sentences.chinese: 还有其它研究指出春天出生的人喜欢动脑。

sentences.english: You haven't used your noodle, so you got ripped-off.
sentences.chinese: 因为你没有动脑子，所以就被人家骗了。

sentences.english: They seldom labour their wits on thankless task.
sentences.chinese: 他们很少为吃力不讨好的工作动脑筋。

sentences.english: Let's beat our brains out to find a solution.
sentences.chinese: 让我们动动脑找出解决的办法。

definition: to use one's mouth (to say sth)
to do (sth) oneself/to help oneself to
to learn by rote/to mechanically memorize
with familiarity you learn the trick (idiom); practice makes perfect
